column4: hello, after doing a port scan on my machine i have this as an open port : ansyslmd . please how do i shut this off ?
it seems that its the ansys license manager... do you use ansys on your linux box??
i don't even know what that is
google says it's a xp thing, yet i run 7.10. any ideas?
ansys is a FEM (finite element method) package iirc
netstat -putan | grep -i ansys
upon doing that command it shows nothing ( it also asked me to be root)
is it possible that port/program is running on another machine on my lan ?
how did tyou run the port scan? if you scanned all the LAN and not only your host it is possible
so as long as netstat -putan | grep -i ansys shows nothing, i should start looking at other machines on the LAN ?
well i'm not sure what the command did is check if you have a daemon running with the ansys wrod on it
so since i show no open process, yet an open port , it's possible it's a different machine.....
i dunno without knowing how you did the port scan...
https://www.grc.com/x/ne.dll?bh0bkyd2
that is the url reporting the open port
are you behind a router??
yes
maybe is the router the one reporting that open port?? or a server in the DMZ ??
no dmz ips in the router
http://www.grc.com/port_1055.htm   Can you do 'netstat -putan | grep 1055'
i show no open ports on this machien. so i need to unhook one by one and track this down...
good luck
thank you for your help
no problem
